pullRequest.body:
This commit is a small step towards proving that all derivations of a finite-dimensional semisimple Lie algebra over a field are inner; an objective mentioned here: https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/Derivations.20on.20Lie.20algebras. The proof will use the Killing form on the module of Lie derivations. The Killing form's API requires to work on modules which are both free and finite.

This commit proves that, when `L` is a Lie algebra of finite dimension over a field, the module `LieDerivation R L L` is finite.

nodes.body:
Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8580912117/job/23517444996)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8580912117/job/23517444886)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8580912117/job/23517444961)
Thanks for sticking with this. It took me quite some time to get used to how the library is set up and you seem to be flying!
Does inferInstance work? Any module over a field is free.
It does, indeed. Thank you! So I removed this instance. However it seems that the `Module.Finite` one is still required.

It's not so important that the lemmas are generalised but the definition `toLinearMapLieHom` should be defined for general coefficients:
```suggestion
variable (R L : Type*) [CommRing R] [LieRing L] [LieAlgebra R L]
```

More is true, this map is even a morphism of Lie algebras:
```suggestion
def toLinearMapLieHom : LieDerivation R L L →ₗ⁅R⁆ L →ₗ[R] L where
```
(you'll have to add `import Mathlib.Algebra.Lie.OfAssociative`)

```suggestion
/-- The map from Lie derivations to linear endormophisms is injective. -/
lemma toLinearMapLieHom_injective : Function.Injective (toLinearMapLieHom R L) :=
  fun _ _ h ↦ ext fun a ↦ congrFun (congrArg DFunLike.coe h) a
```

```suggestion
instance instNoetherian [IsNoetherian R L] : IsNoetherian R (LieDerivation R L L) :=
  isNoetherian_of_linearEquiv (LinearEquiv.ofInjective _ (toLinearMapLieHom_injective R L)).symm
```
For emphasis, given the above you'll have:
```lean
example {K : Type*} [Field K] [LieAlgebra K L] [Module.Finite K L] :
    Module.Finite K (LieDerivation K L L) :=
  inferInstance
```
Btw feel free to hit the "Resolve conversation" button if you are confident that you have addressed a reviewer's suggestion.
